name: Get Together
description: An app that brings people together at the best attractions.

db_queries.select_users: SELECT * FROM public.users WHERE id=$1, fb_userid=$2, first_name=$3, last_name=$4, availability=$5
db_queries.select_events: SELECT * FROM public.events WHERE id=$1, owner_id=$2, friends=$3, status=$4, name=$5
db_queries.select_attractions: SELECT * FROM public.attractions WHERE id=$1, name=$2, geolocation=$3, rating=$4, city=$5, type=$6
db_queries.insert_user:
INSERT INTO public.users(first_name, last_name, fb_userid, email, profile_img, fb_auth_token) \
                        VALUES($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6) ON CONFLICT (fb_userid) \
                        DO UPDATE SET first_name = excluded.first_name, \
                        last_name = excluded.last_name, \
                        email = excluded.email, \
                        profile_img = excluded.profile_img, \
                        fb_auth_token = excluded.fb_auth_token \
                        RETURNING *
db_queries.insert_event: INSERT INTO public.events(owner_id, attractions_list, friends, status, name) VALUES($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6) RETURNING *
db_queries.insert_attraction: INSERT INTO public.attractions(name, geolocation, rating, city, type, reviews) VALUES($1, $2, $3, $4, $5, $6) RETURNING *
db_queries.update_user: UPDATE public.users SET fb_userid=$1, first_name=$2, last_name=$3, email=$4, phone_number=$5, profile_img=$6, availability=$7, fb_auth_token=$8 WHERE id=$9 OR fb_userid=$10
db_queries.update_event: UPDATE public.events SET owner_id=$1, attractions_list=$2, friends=$3, status=$4, name=$5 WHERE id=$6
db_queries.update_attraction: UPDATE public.attractions SET name=$1, geolocation=$2, rating=$3, city=$4, type=$5, reviews=$6 WHERE id=$7
